meanings.definition: A salt or ester of humic acid.
meanings.sent1: The humate was used as a natural fertilizer for the plants.
meanings.sent2: The scientist studied the properties of the humate in the laboratory.
meanings.sent3: The farmer accidentally spilled the humate on his shoes, making them grow tiny plants!
meanings.sent4: The humate acted like a magical potion, transforming the barren soil into a lush garden.
meanings.sent5: The rich, dark color of the humate made it stand out in the soil.

meanings.definition: A substance formed by the decomposition of plant and animal matter.
meanings.sent1: The humate in the compost pile helped break down the organic material.
meanings.sent2: Gardeners use humate to enrich the soil and promote plant growth.
meanings.sent3: The curious dog rolled in the humate, turning into a muddy mess!
meanings.sent4: The humate spread across the field like a blanket of nutrients for the crops.
meanings.sent5: The earthy smell of humate reminded her of the forest after a rain.
